alert.note: Alert for Bulloch; Candler; Evans; Jenkins; Screven; Tattnall (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued April 05 at 5:28PM EDT until April 05 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: The National Weather Service in Charleston has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for portions of... Screven County in southeastern Georgia... Evans County in southeastern Georgia... Bulloch County in southeastern Georgia... Jenkins County in southeastern Georgia... Candler County in southeastern Georgia... Tattnall County in southeastern Georgia... * Until 630 PM EDT. * At 527 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Herndon to 6 miles southwest of Baxley, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include: Statesboro, Reidsville, Metter, Glennville, Millen, Claxton, Butts, Hagan, Portal, Collins, Cobbtown, Hiltonia, Pulaski, Register and Rocky Ford. This warning includes I-16 between mile markers 96 and 121. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A tornado watch remains in effect for the warned area. Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. Although a tornado is not immediately likely, if one is spotted, act quickly and move to a place of safety inside a sturdy structure such as a basement or small interior room. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.

area.areaDesc: Bulloch; Candler; Evans; Jenkins; Screven; Tattnall
